work.name: Reusably
work.summary: Managing and building a Typescript monorepo, consisting of an API, SPA and multiple Ionic Capacitor applications.
highlights: Researched and periodically incremented the most suitable infrastructure choices such as Prisma/tRPC and Mantine UI to cut our time to release and focus our efforts on product growth.
Built secure user management via OAuth2 with JWT and database managed RBAC permissions.

Implemented fast monorepo development build and typechecking via typescript project references, turbo-repo & debounced reloading. This carried over to a significant reduction in our production build times.
Navigated App Store policies and reduced friction in our release by automating submissions using Fastlane.
Understanding organisational and codebase level cybersecurity concerns and compiling an internal pen test report that passed scrutiny from a large customer.
Created custom native features, including a custom iOS NFC plugin and native Swift views to allow for deferred deep linking, boosting user trust during the onboarding experience.
Integrated with Stripe, Google/Apple Pay, WebSockets, SMTP mail, Firebase push notifications, CI/CD and logging/monitoring services.
Designed low and high fidelity UI designs and added digital pizzazz using React Spring and React Three Fibre.

work.name: GoodHuman
highlights: 100% test coverage on all new code.
Introduced a focus on fulfilling WCAG for new code within our team, documented and shared best practices.

Handled customer tickets as a priority when on bug duty. Identified, triaged and fixed a bug of disappearing data that had been unsolved for 4 months by considering edge cases that happened in the mobile API - which was far outside the scope of the teams focus.

Addressed a flaw in data fetching that flowed up through each domain of the codebase discussed the effects with each product owner and their team. Released with no regressions and followed up with a company wide case-study presentation on the issue.
Along with the team QA engineer took lead on documenting playwright procedures and designing a set of tests software engineers could run to reduce blocks in the release pipeline.
Estimating and time boxing features and delivering within these constraints.
Contributing to and running team & company-wide ceremonies, including sprint planning, stand-ups and retrospectives.
Our small team was recognised and rewarded for consistently working together to plan and release stable features.

work.name: Fans Inc
highlights: Designed and built a payment engine enabling offers, auctions and buy-it-now purchases.

Maintained good error exception handling practices, with guaranteed success or rollback across services by anticipating edge cases. Payments and NFT delivery in particular had to be reliable at each step.
Built and optimised GraphQL schemas using DynamoDB (NoSQL) and AWS AppSync.
Researched and built a custom web3 smart contract using Solidity and a custom NFT minting backend using the Polygon blockchain.
Agile workflow via ClickUp.

work.name: Liquid
work.summary: Working closely in a small team to build elegant, modern websites and SasS products.
highlights: Transformed designs into 100% pixel-perfect web experiences in Vue.js.
Thoroughly tested to ensure pages are responsive and accessible across all browsers.

Flagged that the development could be improved by using DRY processes. Created a deployable Docker container incorporating studios' style libraries, Webpack and CraftCMS. This sped up the deployment of new projects and saved server costs as they could be spun up on demand.
Significantly improved the page speed rating of the studio's SasS product and starter template by introducing code-splitting and tree-shaking.

work.name: AthletesAI
work.summary: Adding features to and maintaining a modern web app built on React.js with an agile workflow via Jira.
highlights: Designing and building maintainable React.js components.
Working with a REST API, MySQL, AWS lambda, PayPal to build features and utilising AWS Appsync and Amplify to add modern features such as WebSockets.

work.name: Dingohead Creative
work.summary: Freelancing and consulting with start-ups and non-for-profits to build small web-based projects.

work.name: University of Adelaide
highlights: Led first-year physics and data science/machine learning tutorials, explaining fundamental techniques using simple mathematical and programming approaches.
Learning how to communicate complex information to diverse audiences.

volunteer.summary: Building/maintaining an online platform that powers matches between refugees and those with spare rooms in the community.

courses: Working with in collaboration to extend a C++ bayesian inference tool.
Carefully documenting my contribution to the codebase and analysing results.
Learning how to scrutinise, debug and carefully test code through stages of its lifecycle to release.
Fundamentals in scientific, mathematical, procedural thinking and computer science.
